t: Fire Phone - Wikipedia
s: 2 weeks ago - The Fire Phone is a discontinued 3D-enabled smartphone developed by Amazon and manufactured by Foxconn. It was announced on June 18, 2014, and marked Amazon's first foray into the smartphone market, following the success of the Kindle Fire. It was available for pre-order on the day it was announced.

Fire Phone: The Rise and Fall of Amazon’s Smartphone Dream | by Lotus Lin | Medium
s: May 25, 2023 - To sweeten the deal, Amazon offered a free year of Prime membership, valued at $99. However, the Fire Phone faced stiff competition from established brands like Apple, Google, HTC, Samsung, and Nokia, which boasted better displays, faster performance, stronger ecosystems, and, in most cases, ...

t: r/Android on Reddit: So, why did the Amazon Fire phone fail as badly as it did?
Fire Phone one year later: Why Amazon's smartphone flamed out - CNET
s: July 24, 2015 - While Amazon was marketing the Fire Phone to all of its Prime customers, the reality was it could only sell the device to anyone willing to sign up with AT&T. That's because Amazon struck a deal with the carrier in exchange for marketing and retail support -- a move commonly made by lower-profile ...

s: The Fire Phone uses a 4.7-inch IPS LCD Gorilla Glass 3 polarized touchscreen display with a pixel density of 315 ppi. Its front features the screen and a rounded rectangular home button below the display. The back, made of the same Gorilla Glass, houses the camera, LED flash, and secondary ...

t: Amazon - Fire Phone | Mobile Phone Museum
s: Ian Fried, the VP who was in charge of the phone, later admitted that despite the differentiation on the product, customers did not really care about it. He also pointed out that Amazon had not aligned the phone with Amazon’s core brand principles of offering great value products.

t: What Was Fire Phone and Why Was it Discontinued?
s: December 27, 2023 - Fire phone was a failed smartphone. Not only was the product overpriced, but its unique features of 3D visualisation and identification was also of no real utility.

t: Amazon Fire Phone review | The Verge
s: This is how life changes when you begin carrying around Amazon’s first smartphone. The Fire Phone, which will be available July 24th for $199 and a two-year contract, is the most immediate and accessible device ever made by the company that endeavors to sell us absolutely everything.
